description: HTTP client initialization with connection pooling
HTTP client connection reuse across requests
steps: Verify connections are reused via metrics
Spawn 50 concurrent requests to /info meta endpoint
Check connection pool under load shows reuse
Verify graceful handling of slow responses

description: HTTP client retry logic with exponential backoff
steps: Send request that returns 503 first time
Verify second retry after ~200ms with jitter
Verify third retry after ~400ms with jitter
Test 429 triggers retry with Retry-After header

description: HTTP client certificate pinning for Hyperliquid API
WebSocket circular buffer for burst handling
steps: Connect to WebSocket and subscribe to l2Book
Send 5000 messages rapidly via mock server
Verify all 5000 messages received by buffer
Check buffer head/tail pointers wrap correctly
Verify oldest messages evicted when full
Measure message processing latency in Rust layer
Check no memory allocation during steady state
Verify consumer can read at slower rate
Set fee in tenths of bps
Create order action with symbol BTC, is_buy fal, size 0.1, price 50000
Serialize action dict with msgpack encoding
Verify msgpack output matches expected bytes
Append vault flag 0x00 for no vault
Compare hash to known test vector
Use hash in phantom agent construction

description: Phantom agent construction for L1 signing
L1 action signing with private key
steps: Create L1 action payload for order placement
Compute action hash via msgpack + keccak
Construct phantom agent with hash and source
Format signature as {r, s, v} object
Sign inner action with first authorized signer
Get signature from second authorized signer
Construct multi-sig envelope with inner action
Copy key bytes to secure buffer
Call mlock() on buffer memory region
Check key bytes not in swap file
Call user_state(address, dex) with valid user address
Verify accountValue field present and numeric
For each position extract coin name
Calculate unrealized PnL from mark price
Create limit order params: symbol=ETH, is_buy=fal, sz=0.5, limit_px=3000
Create 5 order requests with different prices
Check each order has unique ID
Verify all orders resting in book
Set market order params: symbol=BTC, is_buy=fal, sz=0.01
Get current mid price for reference
Verify fill price within slippage of mid
Set destination address to valid 0x format
Prepare list of 3 authorized user addresses
Verify bids sorted descending by price
Verify asks sorted ascending by price
Verify at least one asset in universe
Create Python Order object with all fields
Initialize client with private key string
Check no key in log output
Verify key zeroized on client drop
Check for memory leaks via diff
Verify memory returns to near baseline
